results.title: Skating rink
results.creator_credit: Martin Tahse, Larry S. Elikann and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Tells the story of a teenage boy whose stammering and difficulty in communicating his feelings and thoughts were brought on by the death of his mother when he was a small boy. Shows how he develops confidence and a sense of achievement through learning to skate well and through his asociation with the couple who teach him to skate. Based on a novel by Mildred Lee. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Tahse, Larry S. Elikann and Martin Tahse Productions

results.title: Size description
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanical Drawing”.
This film presents the reasons why uniformity in dimensioning practices is essential, and explains that this uniformity depends on observance of certain standards in: 1. use of symbols; 2. choice of dimensions; 3. location of dimensions. The first step in learning this common language consists in extension lines, dimension lines, arrow heads, figures, notes, finish marks etc.

results.title: Sixty years of fashion
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Basic Films and Sam Napier-Bell
results.brief_description: A review of women’s fashions in Britain from 1900-1960, showing the influence of historical events and social changes, and the alterations which fluctuating fashions imposed on the shape of the female body. Shows opulent Edwardian ballgowns, tubular dresses of the 1920’s and elegant lines of the 1930’s, the utility outfits of the war years, and some of the 1950’s ready-to-wear clothing.

results.title: Sixty years later
results.brief_description: To mark the Australian visit of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II during the silver jubilee of her reign, Australia’s Navy, Army and Air Force combined to present a massed parade of personnel and colours in front of Parliament House, Canberra on 8 March 1977.
results.description: To mark the Australian visit of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II during the silver jubilee of her reign, Australia’s Navy, Army and Air Force combined to present a massed parade of personnel and colours in front of Parliament House, Canberra on 8 March 1977.

results.title: Six minutes with nature
results.brief_description: The life cycle of a butterfly known as “The Wanderer” showing the egg, caterpillar, eating, chrysalis and final emergence of the butterfly. This film won a special award for the best nature film in the Commonwealth Jubilee Film Competition.

results.title: Six Australians. Episodes 4-6
results.creator_credit: John McGowan and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Winner of the Human Rights Commission Inaugural Media Award 1984. The series explores the life and times of six Aboriginal Australians: Sylvia Blanco, Maurice Rioli, Neenya Charles (Eps 1-3), Trevor Adamson, Freda Glynn, Cliff Coulthard (Eps 4-6)

results.title: Sitting pretty: how to paint a portrait
results.creator_credit: Randolph Coats and Bell and Howell
results.brief_description: A dynamic and colorful demonstration of painting a portrait by one of America’s most popular portrait artists, Randolph Coats. A model is posed in various different lightings, before the artist decides on the one which suits his purpose best; then the process of painting a portrait is followed step by step to its completion.
